author: 0xsadcat
content:
Removing selfdestruct seems like an entirely political decision with very thin technical reasoning. I suppose it makes evm implementation easier, but then, it's already implemented <:shrugg:815760796599582740>
The only change that makes technical sense is removing refunds for storage deletion as that becomes hard in verkle trees.

author: 0xsadcat
content:
I see you're someone who creates eips. don't know if you read it, but there's a simple solution: remap storage and code accesses and make them dependent on incarnation. ie incarnation > 0, then all db keys are internally remapped to hash(incarnation || key). that's it.
old storage remains as is, so no refunds, but it's fully backwards compatible on the evm side otherwise.

author: pandapip1
content:
I know. I've already proposed something *very* similar to this: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6190 (see also the two linked proposals)

The reason why SELFDESTRUCT is being deprecated is because *something* about it is going to change, whether it's being removed completely, changed to SENDALL, changed to DEACTIVATE, or changed in the manner I proposed

author: 0xsadcat
content:
hmm, yeah the automated proxy idea is also backwards compatible except for gas cost, as in theory it can lead to really long chains
I think the internal remapping is better for this reason

author: pandapip1
content: Actually, it doesn't, since when a chain that's more than one hop long is detected, the relevant addresses are updated
